unit_notes.final_viewers: average viewers for championship match (where reported)
unit_notes.total_viewership: total viewers across the season (where reported)
unit_notes.playoffs_total_viewers: total viewers across playoff matches (where reported)
unit_notes.streaming_growth_percent: year-over-year percent change in streaming audience (where reported)

eras.name: Early Streaming Era
eras.notes: Games were primarily free streams on YouTube or team websites. Useful as baseline context; data is sparse.

eras.name: National Broadcast Expansion
eras.notes: Initial TV distribution via ESPN/Fox, with limited match packages.

eras.name: Lifetime / A&E Era
eras.notes: Three-year agreement with Lifetime; A&E took an equity stake; regular-season averages reported.

eras.name: Modern Multi-Platform Growth
eras.notes: CBS + streaming platforms drive larger audiences; totals and playoff aggregates appear more often.

data_points.notes: Reported live views per match on YouTube (article context also mentions much lower averages earlier in season).
